answers.answer: Type 1 Diabetes is a rough condition for a young child to cope with and can definitely cause emotional/psychological problems. I would talk to her regular doctor and ask him if he thinks a referral to either a diabetic specialist who works with children or a children's therapist. If she is willing to do so you might also consider having her attend  adiabetic children's camp as it is a good way for her to meet other children, normalize her condition and have her learn new coping skills.

question: MY 8 YEAR OLD LITTLE GIRL SEEMS TO BE EXPERIENCING SOME FORM OF PANIC,EVER SINCE SHE HAS BEEN DIAGNOSED WITH TYPE ONE DIABETES IT HAS GOTTEN PROGRESSIVLY WORSE OVER THE YEARS , DO YOU FEEL THERE COULD BE A LINK BETWEEN THE TWO? AND ANSWERS WOULD BE APPRECIATED THANK YOU
title: diabetic disorders in children
